Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Cantharos Jar
Description: A drinking cup of cantharos style; it is made of orange colored clay and painted with metallic black; some parts have lost their color. It has a round bowl and a high circular base. The cup has two circular handles attached at the top of the bowl. Cantharoi were the most popular drinking cups that were used in the Hellenistic period. They are larger than the cups known as skyphoi.
